job.title: Data Scientist
job.description:
Our rapidly growing, industry-leading client in Greenville, SC is looking for a Data Scientist.
In this role, you will be responsible for developing solid and sound predictive models, monitoring the performance of the models, and improving business decisioning using statistical approach and machine learning techniques. If this sounds like the role for you, we'd love to hear from you!
*Please note, this is an onsite role in Greenville, SC*
Responsibilities
Build origination stage marketing and risk models used to approve, decline, or price loans for applicants
Build collections models used to optimize operational payment collections activities, and recovery of deficient balances
Design, develop and execute model-monitoring frameworks
Communicate and present analytical findings to management and build business cases for proposed improvements
Research, develop, and test analytical and modeling tools used by the team
Mentor junior modelers or data analysts on data queries, modeling methodologies, and analytical approaches
Independently own projects end to end
Requirements
Minimum of bachelor’s degree required. Master’s degree in statistics, data science, or other quantitative fields with strong knowledge in statistics and machine learning is preferred.
Minimum two (2) years’ experience in a related field
Intrinsically motivated with demonstrated ability to take initiative, identify needs, make recommendations for improvement, see recommendations through implementation, and evaluate improvements for effectiveness
Exceptional interpersonal skills: friendly and tactful with the ability to influence others, effectively manage conflict, exercise sound judgment, effectively manage highly sensitive and confidential information, interact at all levels within the organization, and build cross-functional partnerships across the business
Exceptional oral and written communication skills.
Team player that can adapt in a fast pace and changing environment
Proficient computer skills with working knowledge of internet and standard business applications such as Microsoft Office; ability to quickly learn new computer applications as required
Demonstrated ability to motivate and lead a team - provide quality training, guidance, performance coaching and feedback to assigned staff
Excellent organizational skills with high attention to detail and demonstrated ability to effectively set and manage multiple conflicting priorities
Demonstrated ability to establish and enhance processes to improve business results
For confidential consideration, email careers@forgesc.com or apply directly!
